2. The second sub-chapter
The Awakened One

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha:

original: “Jāgaro cassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vihareyya sato sampajāno samāhito pamudito vippasanno ca tattha kālavipassī ca kusalesu dhammesu.🔽Jāgarassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viharato satassa sampajānassa samāhitassa pamuditassa
analyzed: jāgaraḥ cassa bhikkhave bhikkhu vihareyya sataḥ sampajānaḥ samāhitaḥ pamuditaḥ vippasannaḥ ca tattha kāla vipassī ca kusalesu dhammesu  jāgarassa bhikkhave bhikkhunaḥ viharataḥ satassa sampajānassa samāhitassa pamuditassa
translated: “Monks, a monk should live the awakened one’s life, being mindful, fully aware, and with his heart full of joy, full of rapture, full of peace, and seeing the right time to visit families that are practicing virtue.

original: vippasannassa tattha kālavipassino kusalesu dhammesu dvinnaṁ phalānaṁ aññataraṁ phalaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—
analyzed: vippasannassa tattha kāla vipassino kusalesu dhammesu dvinnam phalānam aññataram phalam pāṭikaṅkha
translated: For a monk who lives the awakened one’s life, being mindful, fully aware, and with his heart full of joy, full of rapture, full of peace, and seeing the right time to visit families that are practicing virtue, one of two fruits may be expected:

original: diṭṭheva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: diṭṭhā iva dhamme aññā sati vā upādisese anāgāmi tā ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: knowledge and insight right here and now, or, if there is a trace of clinging left, non-return.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“Those who are awake should listen,
those who are sleeping should wake up!
It is better to be awake than to be asleep,

original: natthi jāgarato bhayaṁ.🔽Yo jāgaro ca satimā sampajāno,
analyzed: na atthi jāgarataḥ bhaya  yaḥ jāgaraḥ ca satimā sampajānaḥ
translated: for there is no fear for the one who is awake.🔽The one who is awake, mindful, fully aware,
concentrated, joyful, and peaceful,
When he examines the Dhamma in the proper way,

analyzed: eka udi bhūtaḥ vihane tamam saḥ
translated: he becomes one-pointed and dispels the darkness.
Therefore, you should resort to watchfulness,
a monk who is ardent, discerning, and has attained jhāna.
Having cut off the fetter of birth and aging,

original: Idheva sambodhimanuttaraṁ phuse”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: idhā iva sambodhim anuttaram phusa iti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: he will experience right here the supreme peace.”
This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. Thus I have heard.
